titleStmt.title: Cambridge, Massachusetts, Harvard Law School, MS 1.

msItem.title: Bracton, De legibus Angliae; Magna carta with statutes; legal and historical texts

history.provenance: Provenance: Signatures (Prudence Jones, Edmund Cheyne, ‘Augier’), 15th–16th c.; Thomas Bryan Richards in 1801; sold by Thorpe to Phillipps, no. 3510, in 1827; G. Dunn, 1899.

listBibl.bibl: Bibliography: De Ricci, p. 1022, no. 1; ELMUSA, p. 14.

body.p:
Cambridge, Massachusetts, Harvard Law School
MS 1. Bracton, De legibus Angliae; Magna carta with statutes; legal and historical texts. 206 ff. 400 x 260 cm.
Provenance: Signatures (Prudence Jones, Edmund Cheyne, ‘Augier’), 15th–16th c.; Thomas Bryan Richards in 1801; sold by Thorpe to Phillipps, no. 3510, in 1827; G. Dunn, 1899.
Bibliography: De Ricci, p. 1022, no. 1; ELMUSA, p. 14.
